name: dimatis
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

stmt.origin: mpbi(wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)), wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)))

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w1, w0))
-| wb(wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w1, w0))
-| wb(wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)))

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w1, w0))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wex(s0, wa(w1, w2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wb(wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wex(s0, wa(w1, w2))

body.origin: |- wb(wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wex(s0, wa(w1, w2))

comment: "Dimatis", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. Some ` ph ` is ` ps ` , and all ` ps ` is ` ch ` , therefore some ` ch ` is ` ph ` . In Aristotelian notation, IAI-4: PiM and MaS therefore SiP. For example, "Some pets are rabbits", "All rabbits have fur", therefore "Some fur bearing animals are pets". Like ~ darii with positions interchanged. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.) Shorten and reduce dependencies on axioms. (Revised by BJ, 16-Sep-2022.)
